explanation: formal; the act of accepting or agreeing to something, often unwillingly
sentence: His acquiescence in the nuclear deal may have been a tactical concession.
sentence_gap: His ____________ in the nuclear deal may have been a tactical concession.

explanation: the act of taking something for your own use, usually without permission
sentence: The author objected to the appropriation of his story by an amateur filmmaker.
sentence_gap: The author objected to the _____________ of his story by an amateur filmmaker.

explanation: an electric device with blades that turn quickly, used to move the air around
sentence: There was no air conditioning, just a ceiling fan turning slowly.
sentence_gap: There was no air conditioning, just a ceiling ___ turning slowly.

explanation: to (cause something to) become firmly fixed together, or in position, or closed
sentence: Make sure your seat belt is securely fastened.
sentence_gap: Make sure your seat belt is securely ________.

explanation: a deep, long sound showing great pain or unhappiness
sentence: We could hear the groans of the wounded soldiers.
sentence_gap: We could hear the ______ of the wounded soldiers.

explanation: a typical characteristic or feature of a person or thing
sentence: Simplicity is a hallmark of this design.
sentence_gap: Simplicity is a ________ of this design.

explanation: an activity that is done for enjoyment
sentence: Watching television now seems to be the most popular national pastime.
sentence_gap: Watching television now seems to be the most popular national _______.

explanation: (of clothes) torn and not in good condition
sentence: The children were wearing dirty, ragged clothes.
sentence_gap: The children were wearing dirty, ______ clothes.

explanation: formal; to feel or show great happiness about something
sentence: Everyone rejoiced at the news of his safe return.
sentence_gap: Everyone ________ at the news of his safe return.

explanation: formal; connected with the real physical world, not spiritual matters
sentence: Although spiritual leader of millions of people, the Pope has no temporal power.
sentence_gap: Although spiritual leader of millions of people, the Pope has no ________ power.
